Shrek was sitting in his swamp, watching one of his favorite movies, Murder on the Orient Express. Suddenly, he heard a strange noise coming from the bushes. He turned to see Ingrid Bergman's character, Greta Ohlsson, standing in front of him.

"Hello there, Shrek," she said in her iconic Swedish accent. "I must say, I'm a big fan of your work. Especially that time you rescued the princess and battled the dragon."

Shrek was taken aback. "Uh, thanks? I think?"

Greta chuckled. "I've been watching you, Shrek. And I must say, you have a certain... je ne sais quoi. Just like me in my role as Greta Ohlsson."

Shrek's eyes widened in excitement. "You're Ingrid Bergman! I can't believe it!"

Greta smiled. "The one and only. And I must say, I'm impressed by your knowledge of movies. You have a true passion for the art form."

Shrek beamed with pride. "Thanks! I love movies. They're the best way to escape reality and experience amazing stories and characters."

Greta nodded in agreement. "Indeed they are, Shrek. And I must say, I'm glad to have met you. You have a certain... charm that reminds me of myself when I was younger."

Shrek blushed at the compliment. "Thanks, Ingrid... I mean, Greta."

Greta chuckled and patted Shrek on the back. "Keep watching those movies, Shrek. And never forget the power of a good story."

With that, Greta disappeared back into the bushes, leaving Shrek to ponder the encounter.
